content: as heville by caroline hegwer for the noble thread www thenoblethread com modeled by skye hegwer asheville sizes xs s m l xl finished garment chest measurement 36 38 40 5 43 25 46 garment shown on model is size s with 2 positive ease materials cestari mount vernon 2 ply worsted 170 yards per skein in primrose peach 4 5 5 6 6 wool artist fingering 463 yards per skein 1 1 1 1 2 2 of each colorway van gogh c1 and abbreviations raspberry macaron c2 k knit us 11 32 circular needle p purl darning needle stitch markers pm place marker gauge sm slip marker 11 stitches and 17 row per 4 k1tbl knit stitch through the back loop inches in stockinette stitch k2tog knit 2 stitches together notes ssk slip one stitch knitwise slip one stitch knitwise insert left asheville is a quick to knit needle through front of these 2 stitches and knit them together seamless top down cardigan the chunky gauge is achieved by knitting with one strand of heavy casting on worsted yarn and a strand of fingering hand-dyed yarn held with one strand of cestari and c1 held together using the together the fade effect is tubular cast on cast on 59 67 71 79 83 stitches you can created by using 2 colorways of substitute the long tail cast on if you prefer fingering yarn and fading one into the other over a few row for help with the tubular cast on you can watch this video wide bands of k1 p1 rib frame the https //m youtube com/watch v=tsp60ohulle purl side out garment the fit is effortless perfect for a weekend in asheville for personal use only asheville knitting the collar row 1 k1 p1 till the end ending k1 row 2 p1 k1 till the end ending p1 repeat row 1 and 2 until the collar measures 6 from cast on edge ending with row 2 knitting the yoke row 1 k1 p1 3 times k1 pm p8 9 10 11 12 pm p6 8 8 10 10 pm p17 19 21 23 25 pm p6 8 8 10 10 pm p8 9 10 11 12 pm k1 p1 3 times k1 row 2 p1 k1 3 times p1 sm k till next marker m1l sm m1r 4 times k till last marker sm p1 k1 3 times p1 row 3 k1 p1 3 times k1 p till last marker k1 p1 3 times k1 repeat row 2 and 3 14 15 16 17 18 more times you will have 15 16 17 18 19 increase holes on both sides of each sleeve for all sizes knit 2 more row in stockinette stitch while keeping the 7 edge stitches on each side in k1 p1 rib ending with a purl row dividing for sleeves p1 k1 3 times p1 sm k till 1 stitch before next marker k1tbl remove marker sleep sleeve stitches onto holder cast on 2 stitches
